Can you provide an overview of the African savanna elephant, including its physical characteristics, habitat, diet, and behavior? Please present your response in a formatted table as shown below:
| **Physical Characteristics** |  |
| --- | --- |
| Scientific Name | Loxodonta africana |
| Height | 8.2-13 ft |
| Weight | 5,000-14,000 lbs |
| Trunk | Long and flexible |
| Tusks | Large and curved |
| Ears | Large and fan-shaped |
| Tail | Long and ending in a tuft of hair |
| **Habitat and Range** |  |
| --- | --- |
| Habitat | Grasslands, savannas, forests, and deserts |
| Range | Sub-Saharan Africa |
| **Diet** |  |
| --- | --- |
| Diet | Herbivorous |
| Primary Food Sources | Grasses, leaves, bark, fruits, and vegetables |
| **Behavior** |  |
| --- | --- |
| Social Structure | Matriarchal |
| Communication | Vocalizations and body language |
| Lifespan | 50-70 years |
| Threats | Poaching and habitat loss |

| **Physical Characteristics** |  |
| --- | --- |
| Scientific Name | Loxodonta africana |
| Height | 8.2-13 ft (2.5-4 meters) |
| Weight | 5,000-14,000 lbs (2,268-6,350 kg) |
| Trunk | Long and flexible, used for feeding, drinking, and social interactions |
| Tusks | Large, curved, and primarily used for digging, stripping bark, and defense |
| Ears | Large and fan-shaped, aiding in thermoregulation |
| Tail | Long, ending in a tuft of hair, used to swat away insects |

| **Habitat and Range** |  |
| --- | --- |
| Habitat | Grasslands, savannas, forests, and occasionally deserts |
| Range | Widely distributed across Sub-Saharan Africa |

| **Diet** |  |
| --- | --- |
| Diet | Herbivorous, requiring large quantities of vegetation daily |
| Primary Food Sources | Grasses, leaves, bark, fruits, and occasionally cultivated crops like vegetables |

| **Behavior** |  |
| --- | --- |
| Social Structure | Matriarchal, living in family groups led by an older female |
| Communication | Complex, involving vocalizations (trumpeting, rumbling), body language, and infrasound |
| Lifespan | 50-70 years in the wild |
| Threats | Primarily poaching for ivory and habitat loss due to human encroachment and agriculture |

The African savanna elephant is the largest land animal on Earth and plays a crucial role in its ecosystem, aiding in seed dispersal and creating pathways for other animals. Conservation efforts are vital to ensure their survival in the wild.
